snippet.title: Kindle Touch's secret weapon: Lasers
snippet.description:
* Amazon.com CEO Jeff Bezos borrowed from Dr. Evil's master plan for the technology behind his newly announced Kindle Touch e-reader: It uses frickin' laser beams.
http://www.cnn.com/2011/09/29/tech/gaming-gadgets/kindle-touch-screen/index.html

snippet.title: The Himba: Namibia's iconic red women
snippet.description:

snippet.title: 'The X Factor' top 5 recap: Shut up and dance
snippet.description:
* Weird night! The Top 5 were informed 24 hours before Wednesday's performance show that they'd have to sing their Save Me songs instead of the songs they'd been preparing all week for the Pepsi Challenge.
http://www.cnn.com/2011/12/08/showbiz/tv/x-factor-top-5-recap-ew/index.html

snippet.description:

snippet.title: Color E Ink comes to electronic readers
snippet.description:
* E Ink screens, which are designed to be easy on the eyes, are used widely in electronic book readers like the Amazon Kindle and Sony Reader. But they never featured color displays until now.
http://www.cnn.com/2010/TECH/innovation/11/08/color.eink.reader/index.html

snippet.title: Are we spell-bound by e-books?
snippet.description:
* Imagine a magic scroll, one that contains a myriad of stories and tells you a different one every night. One that fetches you the morning news, generates customized crossword-puzzles, keeps an eye on your favorite authors and an ear on the local grapevine. Imagine a living, breathing kiosk of brain-candy and a library of literature that's easy to r...
http://www.cnn.com/2008/TECH/06/05/digitalbiz.ebooks/index.html

snippet.title: Flat-screen or flowers? What belongs on your mantel
snippet.description:
* A fireplace isn't just a spot to keep logs and kindling. According to decorators and design enthusiasts, it's where you put your heart on display.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/07/09/living/open-house-mantels/index.html
